title: Dollywood Prepares for Fall Season Transition as Summer Celebration Continues
author: Kolby Johnson
excerpt: As the Smoky Mountain Summer Celebration enters its final week, Dollywood begins preparations for the upcoming Harvest Festival scheduled to begin September 12th.
content:
Fall Festival Preparations Begin

With the Harvest Festival set to begin September 12th, Dollywood's operations teams are beginning early preparations for the seasonal transition. The award-winning Harvest Festival, which has been recognized as one of the best fall events in the theme park industry, will feature thousands of pumpkins, fall decorations, and seasonal entertainment throughout the park.

Harvest Festival Planning in Motion

The upcoming Harvest Festival will include the return of popular attractions like the Great Pumpkin LumiNights, which features illuminated pumpkin displays throughout the park during evening hours. The festival typically includes over 12,000 pumpkins in displays across the park's various themed areas, creating an autumn atmosphere for guests.

New Additions Planned for Fall

Dollywood has announced that the 2025 Harvest Festival will include a new area called Candy Corn Country, adding to the fall festival offerings. This addition will join established festival favorites and provide additional seasonal experiences for guests visiting during the autumn months.

Seasonal Transition Process

The transition from summer to fall programming at Dollywood involves changing decorations, updating entertainment schedules, and preparing seasonal food and merchandise offerings. This annual process typically begins in late summer to ensure the park is ready for the September opening of the Harvest Festival.

Fall Entertainment Schedule Development

Entertainment teams are preparing the performance schedule for the Harvest Festival, which will include both returning favorites and new shows for the 2025 season. The Great Pumpkin LumiNights will once again be a featured evening experience, combining lighting effects with the park's extensive pumpkin displays to create a unique fall atmosphere.
